story.text: FRANKFURT Jan 3 European shares closed slightly higher on Wednesday as firmer technology, healthcare and financial shares offset declines for basic resources and energy stocks. The FTSEurofirst 300 index of top European shares .FTEU3 closed unofficially with a gain of 0.07 percent to 1,502.83 points -- near a six-year high set earlier in the session. Britain's FTSE 100 .FTSE and Germany's DAX .GDAXI edged up 0.1 and 0.2 percent respectively, while the French CAC 40 .FCHI fell 0.1 percent.
story.title: european stocks close marginally higher
